summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (likely from the Southern District of New York) regarding a client of Nascimento's who is cooperating with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, proffer sessions, and the status of the client's cooperation, spanning from July 2019 to March 2021.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is cooperating with the federal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. He is scheduling meetings and proffer sessions with prosecutors on behalf of his client.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest in July 2020. Nascimento references her arrest when checking in with prosecutors about his client's status.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Nascimento's former law partner who previously represented the client now cooperating with the investigation, prior to his death in 2018.

connections.description: Nascimento is the attorney representing a female client who is cooperating with the federal investigation into Epstein/Maxwell.
Former law partners. Nascimento took over representation of Ross's client after Ross's death.
The cooperating client was previously represented by attorney Alan Ross before his death.

events.title: Death of Attorney Alan Ross
events.description: Attorney Alan Ross, who previously represented the cooperating witness, passed away.

events.title: Client Served Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: Nascimento's client was served with a grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Nascimento and his client met with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A proffer meeting was scheduled between Nascimento's client and prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Nascimento references seeing reports of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest and checks in with prosecutors regarding his client's status.

locations: Miami, Florida 33129 (Nascimento's law office at 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor)
Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: A female client of attorney Joseph Nascimento is actively cooperating with the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The client was served with a grand jury subpoena on July 6, 2019, and began meeting with prosecutors shortly thereafter.
Multiple in-person proffer meetings were scheduled and held between the client/prosecutors in West Palm Beach, Florida in 2019.
Prosecutors assured Nascimento that his client's cooperative status and the government's view of her had not changed negatively over the course of the investigation (2019-2021).
The correspondence shows ongoing coordination between defense counsel and prosecutors over a significant period (July 2019 to March 2021) regarding a cooperating witness.
